availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin F. Shepherd (Carter County, KY, constable & grocer)

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky, constable and grocer. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Kennedy Shepherd in Harrison County on August 5,1840. Father of William Shepherd, Mary Shepherd, Sarah Shepherd, Jesse Shepherd, Alsey Shepherd, Zachariah Shepherd, Murray Shepherd, Taylor Shepherd, Olivia Shepherd, Thomas M. Shepherd, Frank Shepherd, Rebecca E. Shepherd, Ben F. Shepherd, and John Shepherd. Constable in Carter County in 1850. Grocer in Carter County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 2, p. 244A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, p. 264.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, Grayson, p. 98A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, Film #000216896, p. 77.
Find A Grave, "Benjamin Franklin Shepherd (1810-1879)," Memorial 112918812, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/112918812 (accessed January 31, 2020).
